title: Party animal becomes legendary Carnival parade director
description: Few Brazilians can claim to dominate their field as much _ and at such a young age _ as the 39-year-old Carnival impresario Leandro Vieira

title: Israel sentences Islamic Jihad member to 22 months in prison
description: The Israeli military says it has sentenced a member of the Islamic Jihad militant group to 22 months in prison after his arrest helped spark three days of heavy fighting in Gaza last year

title: Former top Mexican official convicted of taking millions in bribes from cartel
description: Genaro Garcia Luna, a former senior Mexico law enforcement official, was accused of taking in tens of millions in bribe money that enabled the Sinaloa cartel to operate freely.

title: Cyclone Freddy's battering winds make landfall in Madagascar
description: A slightly weakened Cyclone Freddy has made landfall in Madagascar, where schools, business and public transportation were shut down Freddy was packing winds gusting to 180 kilometers per hour, or about 111 miles per hour, as it came ashore in a national already hit in January by a tropical storm that killed at least 30 people

title: Arne Treholt, Norwegian official and Russian spy, dies at 80
description: He provided NATO secrets to the Soviet Union and Iraq during the Cold War.

title: Saudi Arabia deposits $1 billion into Yemen’s central bank
description: Saudi Arabia has deposited $1 billion into the central bank of Yemen’s internationally recognized government in a bid to bolster the country’s ailing economy, state media said

title: Policeman, musician indicted in Puerto Rico drug case
description: A police officer and a reggaeton singer are among 24 people accused of running a suspected drug-trafficking ring in Puerto Rico

title: Putin assures Russia he will win the war, then suspends nuclear arms deal
description: In a state-of-the-nation speech, President Vladimir Putin ignored his military defeats and casualties in Ukraine but tried to pressure the West by brandishing his nuclear arsenal.

title: Activists urge Jamaica to nix anti-sodomy laws amid violence
description: Activists are demanding that Jamaica repeal a colonial-era law criminalizing gay sex

title: After covid break and Brasília riot, Rio celebrates ‘Carnival of democracy’
description: The welcome return of the world's largest Mardi Gras. The government expected 46 million people to attend festivities across the country.

title: 3 United Nations peacekeepers killed in central Mali
description: The United Nations says three of its peacekeepers were killed and several severely wounded by a a roadside bomb in Mali

title: Russia calls UN meeting on Nord Stream pipelines sabotage
description: Russia has called a Security Council meeting on last September’s explosions at the Nord Stream 1 and 2 gas pipelines from Russia to Western Europe after circulating a resolution calling for a U.N. investigation of the sabotage

title: Guatemalans protest candidate ban
description: Thousands of people demonstrated in Guatemala to protest a court’s decision not to allow an indigenous candidate to register for the country’s June 25 presidential elections

title: What is New START and why is Russia ‘suspending’ its role in the treaty?
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced Tuesday that Moscow is "suspending" its participation in its last remaining arms control treaty with the United States.

title: Roscosmos: Russian spacecraft leak caused by external impact
description: Russian space officials say a coolant leak from an uncrewed Russian supply ship docked at the International Space Station has resulted from an external impact and not a manufacturing flaw

title: A four-day workweek pilot was so successful most firms say they won’t go back
description: 15 percent of employees who took part in the world's largest trial of the four-day workweek said no amount of money could sway them to go back to five-day weeks.

title: Brazil deluge toll hits 44 as search continues for missing
description: The death toll from flooding and landslides in Brazil’s southern state of Sao Paulo has reached 44

title: Bar employees stabbed inspectors at Mexico resort
description: Ten employees of a bar in Mexico’s Caribbean resort of Playa del Carmen are accused of stabbing to death four municipal inspectors

title: Analysis warns of food insecurity for 5.4 million Kenyans
description: An international initiative reports that more than 5.4 million people in Kenya will likely experience acute food insecurity beginning in March as East Africa faces the worst drought in decades

title: Rights group: Mideast governments target LGBTQ people online
description: A rights group says in a new report that security agencies and government officials across several countries in the Middle East and North Africa have been using social media platforms and mobile dating apps to crack down on LGBTQ people

title: Police: Boy among 3 killed at Puerto Rico birthday party
description: Police in Puerto Rico say three people, including a 4-year-old boy, have died after gunmen opened fire at a birthday party

title: Japan bids teary farewell to pandas sent to reserve in China
description: Japanese panda fans bid teary farewells to their idols Xiang Xiang, “super papa” Eimei and his twin daughters who were sent to China to live in a protected facility in Sichuan province

title: Iran sentences alleged US-based militant leader to death
description: Iran’s judiciary says a senior member of a U.S.-based opposition group accused of planning a deadly 2008 mosque bombing has been sentenced to death

title: US Navy Mideast chief says Iran has 'attention of everyone'
description: Iranian attacks in the waterways of the Middle East and elsewhere in the region “have the attention of everyone” as tensions rise over Tehran’s advancing nuclear program

title: Pope intervenes again to restrict celebration of Latin Mass
description: Pope Francis has intervened for the third time to crack down on the celebration of the old Latin Mass, a sign of continued friction with Catholic traditionalists

title: Philippines: Missing plane with 4 aboard crashed on volcano
description: The wreckage of a small plane carrying two Filipino pilots and two Australian passengers has been identified on one of the Philippines’ most active volcanoes

title: Abrahamic House in UAE houses a church, synagogue and mosque
description: A new complex erected on the shores of the Persian Gulf, in the capital of the United Arab Emirates, houses a Catholic church, a Jewish synagogue and an Islamic mosque

title: Scientist behind gene-edited babies eyes work in Hong Kong
description: A Chinese scientist who set off an ethical debate five years ago with claims that he made the world’s first genetically edited babies says he hopes to research rare hereditary diseases in Hong Kong

title: Follow the 600-mile front line between Ukraine and Russia
description: Over the last year, the war has morphed from a multi-front invasion to a conflict of attrition largely concentrated along a 600-mile stretch in the east and south.

title: How Russia’s war made Poland a key pit stop for Biden and other leaders
description: Poland was once criticized for its domestic policies, but a year of war has made it indispensable to Europe's and the United States' plans for Ukraine.

title: Ruins of Turkish city of Antakya tell story of a rich past
description: The city of Antakya, known as Antioch in ancient times, has been destroyed many times by earthquakes

title: Fears, questions about N. Korea's growing nuclear arsenal
description: North Korea’s recent resumption of missile tests highlights underscores its resolve to win the international recognition of a legitimate nuclear state and win outside concessions

title: NBA All-Star Game singer changes Canadian anthem in nod to Indigenous rights
description: At the NBA All-Star Game, R&B singer Jully Black made a change to the Canadian national anthem lyrics to recognize Indigenous peoples.

title: Jerusalem demolitions gain pace under Netanyahu, enraging Palestinians
description: The rate of Palestinian homes in Jerusalem being destroyed is the highest in years with 39 already demolished in January.

title: Biden in Poland live updates: President visits Warsaw for talks on Russia-Ukraine war after surprise Kyiv visit
description: President Biden will meet Polish leader Andrzej Duda in Warsaw, after an unannounced trip to Kyiv to signal U.S. commitment.

title: Gunmen kill 2 policemen in attack in southwestern Pakistan
description: A Pakistani official says gunmen have attacked a police post in the insurgency-hit southwestern province of Baluchistan, triggering a shootout that killed two officers

title: Energy agency chief: "No excuse" for high methane emissions
description: The International Energy Agency on Tuesday accused fossil fuel industries of doing too little to curb methane emissions and undermining global climate goals to limit warming

title: Austrian children take government to court over climate
description: A dozen minors filed a lawsuit with Austria’s top court Tuesday seeking to force the government to ensure their constitutional rights are protected by taking tougher action against climate change

title: One-year mark of Ukraine invasion looms large over Biden’s Poland trip
description: Biden heads to Poland as the White House tries to shore up the alliance backing Ukraine while warning Kyiv that now is its best chance to turn the tide of war.

title: Putin to give key speech as Ukraine war nears a year and support dips
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin faces the delicate task of justifying an invasion without victory as the anniversary of his war looms.
